findings.title: Debug Enabled For Application
findings.description: Debugging was enabled on the app which makes it easier for reverse engineers to hook a debugger to it. This allows dumping a stack trace and accessing debugging helper classes.

findings.title: Content Provider (edu. ksu. cs. benign. provider. UserDetailsContentProvider) is not Protected. [android:exported=true]
findings.description: A Content Provider is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device.
findings.recommendation: It is recommended to set the protection level to signature, so only applications signed with the same certificate can obtain the permission.

findings.title: Activity (edu. ksu. cs. benign. UserDetailsActivity) is not Protected. An intent-filter exists.
findings.description: A  Activity is found to be shared with other apps on the device therefore leaving it accessible to any other application on the device. The presence of intent-filter indicates that the Activity is explicitly exported.
findings.recommendation: It is recommended to set the protection level to signature, so only applications signed with the same certificate can obtain the permission.
